abstract.text: A transition that creates a glitchy and distorted look by adding noise and bars to the outgoing view while also simulating a dripping liquid effect.
A transition that creates a heart shape that expands to reveal the incoming view.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view as it cross-hatches into a grid of lines, which then animate away to reveal the incoming view underneath. This creates the illusion of the incoming view being drawn by the outgoing view in a cross-hatched fashion.
A transition that creates a shutter-like effect that fade the outgoing view while simultaneously revealing the incoming view underneath through horizontal slats.
A transition that involves animating the outgoing view by rotating it around an axis to reveal the incoming view behind it, giving the illusion of a 3D cube being rotated.
A transition that bounces the outgoing view towards the bottom of the screen while simultaneously revealing the incoming view.
A transition that reveals the incoming view over the outgoing view in a specific direction.
A transition that simulating the effect of wind blowing over it.
A transition that creates a smooth animation that fades in the incoming view, while simultaneously fading out the outgoing view.
A transition that applies a kaleidoscope effect to the view, with each slice of the kaleidoscope being scaled and sheared based on a power function.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view as it wipes away in a certain direction to reveal the incoming view. This creates the illusion of the incoming view “pushing” the outgoing view out of the way.

A transition that involve splitting a view into multiple copies that are reflected and rotated to create a symmetrical, repeating pattern. This effect is similar to looking through a kaleidoscope toy.

A transition that applies a color transformation to the outgoing view by blending its colors with a specified color. The blending is done using a linear interpolation between the outgoing view colors and the specified color.
A transition that zooms out the outgoing view while simultaneously zooming in the incoming view, creating a cross-like effect.
A transition that animates the incoming view as if it were being pushed into the screen, while simultaneously pushing out the outgoing view.
A transition that creates a colorful wave effect that moves across the screen, with colors separated based on the colorSeparation..
A transition that involve zooming in on a view in a circular motion, with effects like rotation, scaling, or opacity changes.
A transition in which the incoming view fades in while the outgoing view is wiped off the screen to the right.
A transition that creates a playful and dynamic animation by revealing the incoming view through a series of polka dots that slide away to uncover the incoming view.
A transition that involves transitioning between different color schemes or hues, resulting in a dynamic and visually engaging effect.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view using a Perlin noise function, which creates a smooth, organic-looking animation that resembles a swirling or flowing motion. The incoming view is then revealed after the animation of the outgoing view has completed.
A transition that applies a melting effect to the outgoing view, where the view melts away into the incoming view based on the luminance values of each pixel.
A  transition that involves animating a view to transform into a bowtie shape, where the center of the bowtie is aligned with the vertical axis of the screen.
A transition  that gradually fades out the outgoing view while simultaneously fading in the incoming view, creating a smooth transition between the two.
A  transition that fades out the outgoing view, while simultaneously sliding in the incoming view from the bottom.
A transition that morphs the outgoing view into the incoming view, creating a smooth transformation between the two views.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view as if it were a circle that gradually expands and reveals the incoming view behind it. This creates the illusion of the incoming view “bursting” into the user interface.
A transition that scales the incoming view from a large size to its full size while simultaneously fading out outgoing view.
A transition that simulates a burn-out effect on the outgoing view, revealing the incoming view underneath. The transition creates a wave-like distortion effect that moves across the view.
A transition that involve adding blur, fade, or color effects to create a soft, hazy, or ethereal look and feel.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view as it disintegrates into a grid of pixels, which then animate away to reveal the incoming view underneath. This creates the illusion of the incoming view being revealed by the outgoing view in a pixelated fashion.

A transition that combines two views by multiplying the color values of the outgoing view and the incoming view. This creates a blended effect where the resulting colors are darker than the original colors of either view.
A transition that applies a blur to the outgoing view as it moves linearly offscreen, revealing the incoming view.
A transition that masks the outgoing view and reveals the incoming view in a circular shape.
A transition that animates the outgoing view as a series of randomly-sized squares that fade out to reveal the incoming view behind them.
A transition that involves animating the outgoing view using polar shape to create a circular motion.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view as it shrinks away from the center of the screen, revealing the incoming view in the process. This creates the illusion of the incoming view expanding into view.
A transition that apply a Swirl effect to both the outgoing and incoming views, causing them to rotate and spiral around a central point.
A transition that applies a water drop effect to the view. This creates the illusion of a water droplet falling onto the surface of the view and creating a rippling effect.
A transition that simulates a 3D stereo viewer. The outgoing and incoming views are split into two sections, and each section is offset slightly to create a sense of depth.
A transition that animates the outgoing view by flipping cells in a grid pattern to reveal the incoming view behind it.
A transition that applies a horizontal distortion to the outgoing view while revealing the incoming view.
A transition that involves simulating the effect of water ripples or waves.
A transition  that simulates the closing of a door to reveal the next view.
A transition that wipes the outgoing view away in a circular motion while simultaneously revealing the incoming view underneath.
A transition that creates a zooming and rotating effect the incoming view.
An effect to transition between two views by breaking the destination view into a grid of smaller tiles and animating them in a way that reveals the underlying source view.
An Advanced and Flexible Framework for Building Engaging Transitions.
A  transition that involve slicing a view into multiple pieces and animating them in a way that creates an illusion of movement or transformation.
A transition that zooms in the incoming view while simultaneously zooming out the outgoing view.
A transition that creates a shape that expands to reveal the incoming view.
A transition that simulates the fragmented appearance of the outgoing view when viewed through a fly’s compound eye.
A transition in which the incoming view fades in while the outgoing view is wiped off the screen to the bottom.
A transition that applies a fade transition to the incoming view, gradually changing it from its original colors to grayscale.
A  transition that fades out the outgoing view, while simultaneously sliding in the incoming view from the right.
A transition that breaks the outgoing view into small tiles and then animates those tiles to reveal the incoming view.
A transition that creates a dynamic and unpredictable distortion of the outgoing view using a noise pattern.
A transition that involves increasing the brightness or exposure of a view beyond its normal levels, resulting in a washed-out or blown-out appearance.
A transition that simulates the motion blur that occurs when an object moves quickly in a certain direction. It blurs the outgoing view in the direction of motion and then reveals the incoming view

A  transition that involves animating the outgoing view as if it were a page of a book that flips over, revealing the incoming view on the other side. This creates the illusion of a seamless transition between the two views.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view to rotate around its vertical axis, revealing the incoming view behind it. This creates the illusion of the incoming view being swapped in for the outgoing view.
A transition that involve creating a wireframe or grid-like effect on a view  by overlaying square-shaped shapes on top of the content.
A transition that simulates the flipping a page in a book. This creates a sense of depth and immersion, as if the user is peeling away a layer to reveal the incoming view.
A transition that involves animating the outgoing view by scaling it down, rotating it, and fading it out, while scaling up, rotating and fading in the incoming view.

A transition that simulating digital or analog signal disruptions, resulting in distorted, fragmented, or pixelated visuals. This effect can be used to create a sense of unreliability or instability, or to convey a sense of nostalgia or retro aesthetics.
A  transition that involves animating a view to transform into a bowtie shape, where the center of the bowtie is aligned with the horizontal axis of the screen.
A  transition that turns the view into a grid of hexagons, which then animate to reveal the incoming view.
A transition that simulating a view burning resulting in a visually dramatic effect.

A transition that uses a mask to displace pixels of the outgoing view to reveal the incoming view. The displacement creates a wave-like effect that can be visually interesting and add a dynamic feel to the user interface.

A transition that involves animating the outgoing view as it shrinks into a circular shape and reveals the incoming view in the process. This creates the illusion of the incoming view emerging from a circular aperture.

A transition that involves using mathematical formulas or equations to create complex and dynamic animations that can simulate various physical phenomena, such as particle systems, fluid dynamics, or fractal patterns.
A transition that spins the outgoing view away to reveal the incoming view.
A  transition that animates the outgoing view in a specified direction, while revealing the incoming view from the opposite direction.

A transition that compresses the outgoing view towards the center of the screen while simultaneously stretching the incoming view from the center to the edges. This can create a sense of compression and expansion that can be used to emphasize the change between views.
A transition that applies a color transformation to the outgoing view such that its colors gradually transform into the colors of the incoming view.
A transition that mimics a TV screen with static noise.
A transition that distorts the outgoing view in a specified direction while simultaneously revealing the incoming view.
A transition that creates a distorted or glitchy effect on a view by using displacement maps.
A transition in which a view appears to rotate as it transitions from one view to another.
